quoteText: It is often when night looks darkest, it is often before the fever breaks that one senses the gathering momentum for change, when one feels that resurrection of hope in the midst of despair and apathy.
I raise up my voice-not so I can shout but so that those without a voice can be heard...we cannot succeed when half of us are held back.
It took me quite a long time to develop a voice, and now that I have it, I am not going to be silent.
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.
Cautious, careful people, always casting about to preserve their reputations can never effect a reform.
Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
If you don't risk anything, you risk even more.
You can never leave footprints that last if you are always walking on tiptoe.
One cannot accomplish anything without fanaticism.
Step out of the history that is holding you back. Step into the new story you are willing to create.
I firmly believe you never should spend your time being the former anything.
I choose to make the rest of my life the best of my life.
In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
Take criticism seriously, but not personally. If there is truth or merit in the criticism, try to learn from it. Otherwise, let it roll right off you.
Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
You can be the lead in your own life.
I learned a long time ago that there is something worse than missing the goal, and that's not pulling the trigger.
Everyone shines, given the right lighting.
If you just set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
There are two kinds of people, those who do the work and those who take the credit. Try to be in the first group; there is less competition there.
We do not need magic to change the world, we carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to imagine better.
When you're through changing, you're through.
It's not the absence of fear, it's overcoming it. Sometimes you've got to blast through and have faith.
And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.
Life isn't just about taking in oxygen and giving out carbon dioxide.
